person.persName: Hardy S. Sypert (Christian County, KY, prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, merchant and postmaster. Tennessee native. Married to Ann C. Sypert. Father of Stephen G. Sypert, Hannibal Sypert, Leonidas A. Sypert, Henrietta Sypert, Sally Sypert, Demetrius F. Sypert, and Teresa N. Sypert. Postmaster of LaFayette, Christian County, from April 29, 1847, to October 1, 1853. Merchant in Christian County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Christian County in 1850. Postmaster of LaFayette from November 5, 1853, to December 23, 1856. Postmaster of LaFayette from December 30, 1857, to May 20, 1862. Merchant in Christian County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.
